intro: Artabotrys modestus subsp. macranthus, commonly known as the large-flowered beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that develop into bright purple berries. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy green surface. The berries are edible for birds and some mammals, playing a role in seed dispersal.
